Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2014 09:39AM angiephnx wrote:   Thank you everyone for your replies.  Since I haven't been working I just feel useless because of all the pain I'm in.     Wilsie you are right about the oncologists only worrying about your cancer stuff.  I told my oncologist when I went to the ER months ago that they asked who my primary care doctor was and I said "my oncologist" (joking of course), but really I never had a reason to see a general practitioner before all of this.     My mets has only been to one of my ribs (as of January), but all of this constant pain to other body parts such as my back and frequent headaches makes me think the cancer is already spread to other areas.  The other day I went to get my eyebrows waxed and my head was lying in a weird position.  4 days later my neck still hurts from being in that position for maybe 5 minutes.  Really???
Posts.Title: Pain all the time? angiephnx springwatch

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2014 04:48PM angiephnx wrote: Thank you everybody!    I know I do tend to overdo it when I'm feeling halfway decent.  I guess it's just hard for me to wrap my head around when only a couple of months ago I was a nurse working in an ICU.  As a matter of fact the last day I worked my patient coded and I was doing CPR even though I was in pain.  Now I'm sitting at home hardly able to even clean my house.  I'm glad to know that's it's not just me though.  I see my family doc tomorrow so hopefully he'll be able to resolve some of my issues.
Posts.Title: Pain all the time? angiephnx springwatch

Posts.Content: angiephnx wrote: I was just recently diagnosed with stage 4 a couple of months ago and it just seems as though I am having some sort of pain all the time.  Starting from about September or so last year I started getting a lot of back pain, but I just attributed it to my job (I'm a nurse).  Well I've been off of work now since February and my back still hurts.  It will start to feel a little ok so I will attempt to do some yard work like pulling weeds, and that night/next day I will be stuck in bed or the couch.  I have oxycodone for pain, but they make me feel funny.  Plus by the time they wear off I'm in excruciating pain.  I know there is a pain thread, but I wanted to see if this is "normal" for stage 4.  I'm only 40 but I feel like an old lady who can barely get around.   Dx 2/28/2012, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IIB, Grade 2, 0/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/16/2012 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 6/28/2012 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left Surgery 6/28/2012 Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 8/27/2012 Whole-breast: Breast, Chest wall Hormonal Therapy 8/27/2012 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Surgery 4/4/2013 Reconstruction (left): Latissimus dorsi flap; Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap Surgery 9/6/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 11/5/2013 Reconstruction (left): Nipple reconstruction; Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Dx 2/13/2014, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, Grade 2, 0/16 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Radiation Therapy 3/6/2014 External: Bone Surgery 3/27/2014 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy 3/29/2014 Arimidex (anastrozole) Radiation Therapy 6/9/2014 Bone Hormonal Therapy 8/15/2016 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Radiation Therapy 9/12/2016 External: Bone Hormonal Therapy 3/26/2018 Faslodex (fulvestrant) Targeted Therapy 8/15/2018 Ibrance (palbociclib) Hormonal Therapy 8/15/2018 Femara (letrozole) Targeted Therapy 12/23/2018 Afinitor (everolimus) Hormonal Therapy 12/23/2018 Aromasin (exemestane) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain all the time? angiephnx springwatch

Posts.Content: angiephnx wrote: Here's a link to a story from a cancer doctor who loses his wife to be east cancer.  It's not inspirational...just a realistic perspective of a man losing his wife over 8 months.  The story is from his perspective of the experience.    I found it interesting because sometimes I can get caught up in my own feelings about having metastatic cancer, and don't think enough about how my husband and other family members feel.  http://nymag.com/news/features/cancer-peter-bach-...
